briefdescription.para: Return options for the work call.

detaileddescription.para: Used by block's setters and work functions to make setting/resetting of parameters thread-safe.

briefdescription.para: Overload me! I am the forecast.
compute output items from input items

detaileddescription.para:
noutput_items
number of output items to write on each output stream
ninput_items
number of input items available on each input stream
input_items
vector of pointers to the input items, one entry per input stream
output_items
vector of pointers to the output items, one entry per output stream
number of items actually written to each output stream, or -1 on EOF. It is OK to return a value less than noutput_items. -1 <= return value <= noutput_items general_work must call consume or consume_each to indicate how many items were consumed on each input stream.

briefdescription.para: Call during work to consume items.
Get absolute count of all items consumed on the given input port.
Get absolute count of all items produced on the given output port.

memberdef.argsstring: (const size_t which_output, uint64_t abs_offset, const pmt::pmt_t &key, const pmt::pmt_t &value, const pmt::pmt_t &srcid=pmt::PMT_F)
memberdef.name: add_item_tag

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< gr_tag_t > &tags, const size_t which_input, uint64_t abs_start, uint64_t abs_end, const pmt::pmt_t &key=pmt::pmt_t())
memberdef.name: get_tags_in_range

detaileddescription.para: Enable fixed rate logic. When enabled, relative rate is assumed to be set, and forecast is automatically called. Also, consume will be called automatically.
The relative rate can be thought of as interpolation/decimation. In other words, relative rate is the ratio of output items to input items.
The output multiple setting controls work output buffer sizes. Buffers will be number of items modulo rounted to the multiple.
Returns the available input message ports for a block. The return object is a PMT vector that is filled with PMT symbols.
Returns the available output message ports for a block. The return object is a PMT vector that is filled with PMT symbols.

simplesect.para: returns pmt at head of queue or pmt_t() if empty.
returns pmt at head of queue or pmt_t() if empty.

briefdescription.para: Tests if there is a handler attached to port which_port.
Set the thread's affinity to processor core n.

parameterdescription.para: a vector of unsigned ints of the core numbers available to this block.

briefdescription.para: Remove processor affinity to a specific core.
